content: The Empowerment Zone Enhancement Act of 1998 may be cited as the funding entitlement for additional enterprise zones. The Empowerment Zone Enhancement Act of 1998 amends the Social Security Act to provide grants for qualified empowerment zones designated under the Internal Revenue Code. The amount of grants is specified in the amendments. The Empowerment Zone Enhancement Act of 1998 provides grants for qualified empowerment zones designated under the Internal Revenue Code. The grants amount varies based on whether the zone is in an urban or rural area and the proportion of the population residing in the State. The Empowerment Zone Enhancement Act of 1998 amends the timing of grants for qualified empowerment zones, including additional zones designated under the Act. Grants are provided to the State where the zone is located upon designation. The Empowerment Zone Enhancement Act of 1998 amends funding provisions for designated zones, providing grants to States for empowerment zones and enterprise communities. The Empowerment Zone Enhancement Act of 1998 allocates an additional $1.7 billion for grants to empowerment zones described in paragraph (1)(C). SEC. 3. RESPONSIBILITY FOR ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW. Section 2007 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection (f) regarding Environmental Review for grants in connection with empowerment zones and enterprise communities designated under the Internal Revenue Code. The responsibility for this review lies with the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and the Secretary of Agriculture are responsible for executing the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 for grants in urban and rural areas related to empowerment zones and enterprise communities. They may also assume responsibilities under other laws to further the Act's purposes. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and the Secretary of Agriculture are responsible for executing the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969 for grants in urban and rural areas. They may also assume responsibilities under other laws to further the Act's purposes, in accordance with specific paragraphs. The Secretary may provide for the release of funds for specific projects under this section if the State, local government, or Indian tribe assumes all environmental responsibilities as specified by regulations. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development and the Secretary of Agriculture will issue regulations in consultation with the Council on Environmental Quality to specify provisions of law applicable to projects under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. Eligibility criteria and procedures for State designation will also be provided. The regulations will specify provisions of law for projects under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, including eligibility criteria and procedures for State designation, monitoring of environmental reviews, training provision, and suspension authority. The Secretary may suspend or terminate assumption responsibilities by the Secretary. The Secretary's duty does not limit any responsibilities assumed by a State, local government, or Indian tribe. The release of funds for projects must be approved by the Secretary at least 15 days prior to approval. The recipient must submit a request for release of funds to the Secretary along with a certification from the State, local government, or Indian tribe. The Secretary's approval of the certification fulfills responsibilities under the National Environmental Policy Act and other relevant laws for projects covered by the certification. The certification authorized by this subsection must be in an acceptable form, executed by the qualifying officer of the State, local government, or Indian tribe, confirming full completion of responsibilities and consent to assume the status of a responsible Federal official under relevant laws. The Secretary may permit the State to perform actions described in regulations for enforcement of responsibilities as a responsible Federal official. The Secretary may permit the State to perform actions described in regulations for enforcement of responsibilities as a responsible Federal official, to satisfy the responsibilities referred to in paragraph (3). SEC. 4. PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT AND EVALUATION; GRANT ADJUSTMENTS. Section 2007 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection (g) regarding Performance Measurement System, Reports, and Evaluations for grants to lead implementing entities for empowerment zones. This subsection applies to all grants made by a State and includes additional requirements in addition to annual report and biennial audit requirements. The lead implementing entity for an empowerment zone must establish a performance measurement system to assess strategic plan implementation and fund utilization. They are required to submit a performance report to the Secretary, detailing progress towards plan implementation and other specified information. The lead implementing entity for an empowerment zone must undergo regular performance evaluations by the Secretary to assess progress in implementing the strategic plan. Adjustments may be made based on these evaluations, with potential direction to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The lead implementing entity for an empowerment zone must keep records of funds received from grants, as determined necessary by the Secretary for evaluation and compliance. The Secretary has access to documents for evaluations and examinations related to grant amounts received in connection with the empowerment zone. Definitions include the lead implementing entity and the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development for grant purposes. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development is responsible for grants in urban areas, while the Secretary of Agriculture is responsible for grants in rural areas under this section. Technical amendments are made to Section 2007(b) of the Social Security Act, including changes to paragraphs (2) and (4) regarding prevention and maintaining.
